ygData.subject: Invisibility versus undead
ygData.msgSnippet: After this issue was brought up yesterday, I went to Unrest to do some testing.  I m a 22d level bard with my Wind skill maxed out.  I started singing the
ygData.messageBody:
After this issue was brought up yesterday, I went to Unrest to do some
testing. I'm a 22d level bard with my Wind skill maxed out. I started
singing the invisibility song and walked throughout Unrest conning
everything I saw. In the yard, death beetles, jack-o-lanterns, and
tormented dead all conned indifferently to me. Didn't get the chance to try
it against a greater skeleton though so don't know about them. I can kill
them easily so not too concerned about them. Inside on the 1st floor, every
ghoul I ran into conned indifferent. I walked by a lesser mummy and it
attacked me so they are the first thing that saw through the invisibility.
Carrion ghouls conned ready to attack. Didn't get the chance to test it
against dark and dry bone skeletons, werebats, or anything tougher. If
anyone has confirmed successes against the tougher creatures then please
post it. Specifically, if someone higher than 22d level can confirm that
the invisibility song works against carrion ghouls for them that would give
credence to the theory that the higher level you are has a direct
correlation on what mobs can see through the invisibility song.

Thanks
Galtin of E'ci

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Chris Kuenster (Entex) [SMTP:v-ntxck@...]
> Sent: Thursday, August 26, 1999 6:08 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Mid-level songs
>
> From: "Chris Kuenster (Entex)" <v-ntxck@...>
>
> Mobs do change levels and acquire new skills if they raise high enough.
> Also
> it may have had spirit sight cast on it by another nearby mob. Aside from
> this I know some Undead see invis just fine whil others not at all. I have
> had Festering hags not see me if they are green to me, and then a blue one
> sees me and scowls. I have walked all the way into the ghost room
> unmolested
> and other times a greater skel or hag will see me. In lower guk all the
> ghouls see invis just fine, while in upper all that can see me is the
> Warden
> and the Lord. I never trust past experience with invis in any area I dont
> know as gospel. Unrest is one of those places you never know whats going
> to
> happen next, I dont care how long you have played there.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: John Kim [mailto:kim@...]
> Sent: Thursday, August 26, 1999 8:48 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Mid-level songs
>
>
> From: John Kim <kim@...>
>
> On Thu, 26 Aug 1999, Talies the Wanderer wrote:
> > At 08:23 PM 8/25/99 -0400, you wrote:
> > >
> > >Almost every time I think something saw through my
> > >invisibility, I scroll back and the message immediately before
> > >I was attacked is "you become visible."
> >
> > Hrm - there has always been some error with the cause and effect timing.
> > Notice how whenever you are bashed, your song ends *before* the monster
> > bashes you? Methinks that they hit you, removing the invisibility. Now
> > how they saw you - well, who knows?
>
> Well, unless you can explain how a mob that I'd safely walked
> through a dozen times before while invisible could suddenly
> see me, I will go with the invisibility blinking off as the
> explanation. :-)
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
